text: Participants dressed as Vikings stand in their long boat on Tuesday, as they prepare to participate in the annual ‘Up Helly Aa’ festival in Lerwick, Shetland Islands, which forms a part of the U.K. The festival celebrates the influence of the Scandinavian Vikings in the Shetland Islands and culminates with up to 1,000 ‘guizers’ (men in costume) throwing flaming torches into their Viking longboat and setting it alight in the evening.— Photo: AFP
title: Celebrating Viking heritage
